skill.name: hummingbot
skill.description: Hummingbot trading bot framework - automated trading strategies, market making, arbitrage, connectors for crypto exchanges. Use when working with algorithmic trading, crypto trading bots, or exchange integrations.
skill.summary: Hummingbot trading bot framework - automated trading strategies, market making, arbitrage, connector...
skill.author: 2025Emma

security_audit.summary: Documentation-only skill containing markdown files. No executable code, scripts, network operations, or filesystem access. Pure informational content about Hummingbot trading framework.

content.value_statement: Hummingbot is an open-source algorithmic trading framework for cryptocurrency markets. This skill provides expert guidance on deploying trading bots, configuring exchange connectors, implementing market making and arbitrage strategies, and integrating with AI agents via MCP.
actual_capabilities: Provide guidance on Hummingbot installation and configuration across Docker and source methods
Explain trading strategy templates including PMM, arbitrage, XEMM, and directional strategies
Describe exchange connector setup for 30+ centralized and decentralized exchanges
Detail Gateway DEX integration for trading on Uniswap, Jupiter, Raydium, and other DEXs
Explain controller-based strategy architecture using V2 framework
Describe AI integration via Hummingbot MCP Server for Claude, Gemini, and Codex
limitations: Does not execute trades or manage funds directly
Does not provide financial advice or trading recommendations
Does not access user exchange accounts or API keys
Cannot install or configure Hummingbot on user systems

use_cases.title: Deploy market making bots
use_cases.description: Configure automated market making strategies on centralized and decentralized crypto exchanges to provide liquidity.

use_cases.title: Build custom strategies
use_cases.description: Create Python-based trading scripts using Hummingbot's V2 controller framework for backtested algorithmic trading.

use_cases.title: Integrate AI agents
use_cases.description: Connect Claude, Gemini, or Codex to Hummingbot via MCP for AI-assisted crypto trading automation.

prompt_templates.title: Getting started
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I install Hummingbot using Docker and connect it to Binance for automated trading?

prompt_templates.title: Configure strategy
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain the Pure Market Making strategy configuration with bid spread, ask spread, and order refresh time parameters.

prompt_templates.title: DEX trading
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I configure Gateway to trade on Jupiter DEX using a Solana wallet?

prompt_templates.title: Custom script
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to create a custom directional trading script using the RSI indicator with PositionExecutor.

output_examples.input: How do I set up a basic market making bot on Binance?
output: â€¢ Install Hummingbot via Docker: `docker pull hummingbot/hummingbot:latest`
â€¢ Run container: `docker compose up -d` then `docker attach hummingbot`
â€¢ Connect exchange: `connect binance` and enter API key/secret
â€¢ Create PMM strategy: `create` then select `pure_market_making`
â€¢ Configure key parameters: bid_spread, ask_spread, order_refresh_time, order_amount
â€¢ Use paper trading mode first to test without real funds

best_practices: Always test new strategies in paper trading mode before deploying real capital
Use balance limits and kill switches to prevent excessive losses
Monitor bot performance regularly and adjust parameters based on market conditions
Keep API keys secure and never share them; Hummingbot encrypts credentials locally
anti_patterns: Running trading bots without understanding the strategy logic or risk parameters
Leaving bots unattended without proper monitoring or kill switches configured
Using excessive leverage or order sizes that exceed your risk tolerance
Neglecting to backtest strategies on historical data before live deployment

faq.question: Which exchanges does Hummingbot support?
faq.answer: Hummingbot supports 30+ exchanges including Binance, Coinbase, OKX, Hyperliquid for CEX trading, and Uniswap, Jupiter, Raydium for DEX trading.

faq.question: What are the system requirements for running Hummingbot?
faq.answer: Docker installation requires Docker Desktop or Docker Engine. Source installation needs Python 3.10+, conda environment, and 4GB+ RAM for compilation.

faq.question: How do I connect AI assistants to Hummingbot?
faq.answer: Use the Hummingbot MCP Server to connect Claude, Gemini, or Codex. Configure in Claude settings with server command and path to hummingbot-mcp directory.

faq.question: Is my data and API keys safe with Hummingbot?
faq.answer: Yes, Hummingbot stores credentials encrypted locally. Passwords and private keys are never sent to external servers. Disable anonymized metrics in config if desired.

faq.question: Why is my bot not placing orders?
faq.answer: Check balance limits, ensure API keys have trading permissions, verify exchange connectivity with `connect` command, and review logs in /logs folder for errors.

faq.question: How does Hummingbot compare to other trading bots?
faq.answer: Hummingbot is open-source, community-governed, and highly customizable. Unlike closed-source bots, you can inspect all code and create custom strategies in Python.
